intro: Hubbardochloa gracilis, commonly known as slender needlegrass, is a perennial grass species native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is characterized by its fine, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has a fibrous root system that helps stabilize soil and prevent erosion. Its botanical features make it an important component of native plant communities in arid environments.
